item.title: 100 Years Of Solitude
item.author: Majid Al-Khalil,
item.description: “Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Aureliano BuendÌa was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover ice…” These are the first words which catapult the reader into Marquez’s vibrant imagination and of a novel that has stayed …

item.title: Tunisia’s revolution: the first of many?
item.author: Majid Al-Khalil,
item.description: On the 17th December 2010 Mohamed Bouazizi went to the office of his regional governor, drenched himself in petrol and set himself alight. He succumbed to his horrific injuries and died some days later. As a twenty six year old high school graduate he was relatively well educated yet despaired at …
